title: Body and Header Font Combos (recommendations)
content:
I work in-house for a water-ski company that is positioning itself as High-End. I’m working on the annual Product catalog and wondering if anyone has any insight besides the usual suspects for header and body and combos. I’ve been looking at some higher-end car brochures like Mercedes and Audi for inspiration. Lots of Helvetica sprinkled with a little Franklin Gothic. Nothing against either but maybe somebody has some other ideas.

Thanks!!!

Billy

 [‹ Walbaum Woes](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009110124/http:/typophile.com/node/49968 "Go to previous forum topic") [Anachronistic Collateral for a badly written play. ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009110124/http:/typophile.com/node/49900 "Go to next forum topic")
author: billybartels

comments.content:
I’ve been wanting a good reason to try Meta Serif. I think the key to so-called high end design is it leans heavily on the information design aesthetic.

You could also go for something a little more obvious. Just as good mind you. [Soul Mates](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009110124/http:/www.fontshop.com/features/newsletters/jun2006_b/) at FontShop.
